name: La Zi Ji (Firecracker Chicken)
author: Adrien
description: A firey Sichuan dish to spice up your life.

actions.step: Marinate the chicken in cooking wine, ginger, black pepper, and chili pepper flakes as well as a generous amount of salt. Generously salting the meat here is necessary for the flavor to permeate.
After marinating the chicken for a few hours (ideally overnight), heat enough frying oil to cover half of a chicken chunk just below the smoke point.
Blotting the excess moisture on a paper towel, dredge the chicken chunks in salted corn starch.
Deep fry the chicken chunks to a golden brown in batches. With sufficiently small chunks, a quick fry should be enough to cook the chunks through while they rest.
Set aside the chicken. Bring stir frying oil up to a medium temperature in a wok and add the dried chili peppers and sichuan peppecorns.
After allowing the spices to infuse into the oil (the oil should turn red), turn up the heat and add the garlic and ginger.
When the aromatics grow fragrant, add the chicken.
Stir fry briefly and add the dark soy sauce and sugar.
When the moisture is mostly gone, finish with the green onions.
Serve hot with something to counter the spice.
